title: Folding Fork And Spoon, early 17th century
markings:
On top of stem: swan in oval; French import mark 1893-1970 Tardy, SILVER (1981) p. 208

On back of spoon bowl: "0" in oval with crown on top Tardy, SILVER (1981) p. 134 or p. 316 ? two illegible marks
inscribed: On back of spoon bowl: R. Bijlsma, Anno 1751 (later)
dimensions:
L x W x D (Fork): 16 x 1.5 x 1 cm (6 5/16 x 9/16 x 3/8 in.)
L x W x D (Bowl): 7 x 5 x 1.5 cm (2 3/4 x 1 15/16 x 9/16 in.)
L x W x D (Overall): 19.5 x 5 x 3.7 cm (7 11/16 x 1 15/16 x 1 7/16 in.)
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description:
Three curved tines, short, rounded shoulders, decorative chiseling at the joint and neck. Hinged at the neck, locket engraved with floral pattern. Square handle with eagle on top.

Large oval-shaped spoon bowl with three rings on the back which can be slotted over the tines of the fork.

tombstone.epitaph:
Folding Fork And Spoon, early 17th century.
early 17th century. Silver. The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg. 1985-103-102-a,b.
